com.luigisgro.cqf.fdm
Class BinaryCashOrNothingOption

java.lang.Object
  com.luigisgro.cqf.fdm.Option
      com.luigisgro.cqf.fdm.BinaryCashOrNothingOption
All Implemented Interfaces:
Derivative
public class BinaryCashOrNothingOption
extends Option
implements Derivative

Implementation of a binary "cash-or-nothing" option. The payoff of this option is 1 if the stock value at maturity is greater or equal to the strike, zero otherwise

Author:
Luigi Sgro

Returns:
A cash flow amount if the derivative generates a cash flow at this point in time +- tStep / 2. Zero otherwise

boundaryValue

public double boundaryValue(double t,
                            double tStep,
                            double s,
                            double r)
Description copied from interface: Derivative
The boundary value for extreme values of the stock. This method must be called with parameters which satisfy the criteria for boundary value (high or low stock value). Otherwise the method generates a runtime exception. In fact if the algorithm calls this method from a point in the grid that do not satisfy the requirements for a boundary point, there is no way to handle it, and the algorithm must be terminated.

Specified by:
boundaryValue in interface Derivative
Parameters:
t - The point in time
tStep - The time step
s - The value of stock
r - The interest rate
Returns:
The boundary value, or raise an IllegalArgumentException if the parameters are within the range

timeToNearestCashflow

public double timeToNearestCashflow()
Description copied from interface: Derivative
If a derivative generates many cash flows during its life, this method must return the time of the last one. Otherwise it will return the time to maturity. This method is used to validate the grid steps for convergence. In fact there is a constraint on the minimum time span in the analysis with respect to volatility and number of stock steps.

Specified by:
timeToNearestCashflow in interface Derivative
Returns:
The last cash flow in time
